intro: Icacina senegalensis, commonly known as African satinwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in axillary inflorescences, followed by small, round fruits containing a single seed. It is often found in dry savannas and woodland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. The tree is valued for its hard, durable wood and has traditional medicinal uses in various African cultures.
